postcontent:
Springfield M1-A with Walnut stock model (MA9102). From 1959 to 1970 the M14 served with distinction as the standard issue rifle of the United States military. When Springfield Armory® in Geneseo, IL made the civilian legal variant – the M1A™ – available to the public in 1974, shooters were finally able to enjoy the same rifle that so many servicemen had utilized in the past. The Standard Series is a faithful semi-auto only recreation of the original M14. Keep in mind that the Standard M1A™ is as well suited for a day at the range as it is for filling that special place in your military collection. All the design features that the Armed Services found essential for a battle rifle make the Standard M1A™ a great shooter. The windage and elevation adjustable rear sight minimizes the effort required to zero the rifle. The two-stage military trigger, detachable box magazine, op-rod and roller cam bolt call to mind the rich history of the M1A™ while providing functional ease of operation and legendary reliability. You may be looking for a special addition to your collection, or you may be looking for a hard-working rifle that will pull duty on the range, in the treestand or in your truck. The Standard M1A™ is ready for its next mission. postcontent: Selling a brand new PWS MK118 chambered in .223 Wylde (chambers .223/5.56mm). The PWS rifle is revolutionary in the AR15 world. It was the first AR15 to have a long-stroke gas piston system. The piston system is very AK47-like, so the reliability is 2nd to none. The bolt carrier group and pistol rod are nickle boron, so they never need lubrication. This rifle is chambered in .223 wylde, which will accept .223 AND 5.56, but will provide more accuracy for .223 compared to shooting .223 out of a 5.56 chamber. The PWS gas system is adjustable for different settings/conditions. The Keymod rail on the rifle allows for multiple attachments. Has magpul flip-up sights. The PWS muzzle break that's pinned and welded on the rifle cuts all recoil from the rifle. Comes with box, manual, gas adjustment tool. title: For Sale:  Kimber Super Carry Ultra .45ACP 3"
postcontent:
I have a very nice, slightly used, Kimber Super Carry Ultra for sale.

One of Kimber's top-of-the-line, compact carry guns (7 + 1 rounds) the Super Carry Ultra not only looks great, it shoots great. Night sights (with a flat shoulder for one-handed operation), rounded heel on the grip, ambi safety, two-tone finish, scallop-type serrations on the slide and front-strap of the grip. This is NOT a Series II gun. This gun DOES NOT have the Ultra Annoying Series II Firing Pin Safety...one of the reasons I like it so much. The other thing I like is the weight...25 ounces empty.

I bought this gun new but have since acquired a Super Carry Ultra + so I have no need for this one.

It includes the box and all the original propaganda and other items shipped with a new gun. One magazine...YOUR CHOICE of the Kimber-supplied mag or a Wilson Combat mag.  Actually, there's no external wear with the exception of a small spot on the left side of the slide. I think that was a weak spot in the finish more than wear because I haven't really carried the gun much at all.

I've owned the gun less than 2 years so the sights are still bright. I probably have fired in the neighborhood of 200 rounds through the gun. It's never had a failure of any type with various types of ammo including steel-cased and various types/brands of hollow points.

Ark Tactical in Lakewood (near Kipling & Hampden) for the required transfer, buyer pays fees.

Benelli's SuperNova Tactical embodies a modular design concept in a 12-gauge pump-action shotgun. At the heart of this pump gun is a lightweight steel skeleton framework over-molded with a high-tech polymer, making the SuperNova Tactical super-light, super-strong, and almost completely impervious to any weather condition. This SuperNova Tactical comes with newly designed, military-style ghost-ring sights (the harder to find version, sold out just about everywhere). The rear sight is click-adjustable for both windage and elevation. A magazine cut-off on the forearm allows for safe carry with a full magazine and empty chamber. The top of the SuperNova's receiver is drilled and tapped to accommodate easy attachment of military-style optics.

The ComforTech stock absorbs nearly 48% of felt recoil to dampen the recoil of heavy buck shot loads. In addition to taming recoil, the ComforTech system minimizes barrel climb, putting you back on target twice as fast as other comparable shotguns. For tight quarters when clearing buildings or in a patrol vehicle nothing beats the compact versatility of the SuperNova.

title: For Sale:  Sporterized 1898 Krag-Jorgenson rifle
postcontent: Thanks for checking out my posting. I have for sale a 1898 Krag-Jorgenson rifle that has been sporterized. While it could be put back into it's original military configuration, those parts are not with the gun. The work appears to have been nicely done. It has been drilled, tapped, and fitted for a Weaver side mount & base for a scope, which is included. The stock is a Fajen with Monte Carlo cheek piece perfect for a scope. It has been fitted with a low scope safety. It has a set of open sights, that can be used also. The wood is in very good condition with only a few dings here and there. The metal is in slightly better than average shape considering its 117 years old! It has some external pitting all over the rifle, but the bore is quite good with strong rifling yet. This is a very nice shooter grade Krag! However, the usual disclaimers. I have not personally fired the rifle, it belonged to a relative, and I have no idea when the last time it was fired. Please have it checked out by a gunsmith before firing. No warranties on the suitability of the use of this firearm are expressed or implied. It is up to the purchaser to determine the safety of this firearm before use. I can provide additional pictures if interested. Would prefer not to ship, local pickup only at this time.

title: For Sale:  Boberg XR9-S
postcontent: 100% American Made.  The Boberg is the most powerful pocket pistol on the market.  A 9MM with a 3.35" barrel but a pocket pistol frame.  Unlike traditional pistols that use the slide to push the round from the magazine up the feed ramp and into the chamber, this pistol actually uses extractor claws to draw the round back, and a lifter to push the round up and align it with the chamber.  This allows for a longer barrel and lower recoil.  The longer barrel means more velocity, accuracy and  Also takes away jams that could be caused by improperly seated ammunition.  (Think a bullpup design applied to a subcompact pistol).  If you have a pocket pistol that you don't shoot because the gun is uncomfortable then this gun has solved your problem.  If you want a pocket pistol that gives you a better chance at surviving a life threatning situation than any other gun in its class then this is the one for you.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Ruger super blackhawk hunter 45lc ks-457nh
postcontent:
This gun is used, in very good condition. Scope rings new in package, factory box matching serial number, no test fire shell. Very limited production of these in 45lc. This one was made in the first production run of 2003 according to ruger. 

RUGER SUPER BLACKHAWK HUNTER  STAINLESS
.45 COLT
7.5" BARREL
LAMINATED GRIPS
Combine the Ruger Super Blackhawk Hunter with the 45 Colt and modern loads and you have a near perfect hunting revolver.
The Ruger Hunter series was always a steady seller in the 44 Magnum.  Ask any 45 Colt fan and they will tell you that the only thing better than a 44 Magnum is a properly loaded 45 Colt!  In the larger Ruger frame, the 45 Colt really turns from a mild "cowboy action" cartridge to a very efficient large bore hunting round.  For factory loads that take advantage of the 45 Colt's potential, check out Buffalo Bore Ammunition and Corbon.  For handloading info, Hodgdon got the ball rolling with the first "Ruger Only" loads section in their loading manuals.
Today, most of the loading manuals have a "Ruger Only" section and this gun is appropriate for those loads. There were two production runs of this model.  The original production run ran from 2003 to 2005 and consisted of 600 guns delivered.  Another 132 guns have trickled in between 2008 to 2010, most of which due to the parts cleanup Ruger has been doing the last few years.  The Ruger Hunter and the 45 Colt cartridge are a natural combination is a very sought after combination.
Single Action Revolver	Integral Scope Mounts
7-1/2" Barrel	Black Laminate Grips
Stainless Steel	Adjustable Sights
53 oz.	6 Shot
Scope Rings Included	Standard Gripframe

title: For Sale:  Mosin nagant type 53
postcontent:
What i have here is a Mosin Nagant Chinese type 53. It is a all numbers matching down to the butt plate. it is unmodified as I am a starting collector of mosin nagants. The rifle is deadly acurate and was shot multiple times and cleaned very well after each trip. The bore is clean and has sharp rifling. The bolt is very smooth and gun functions flawlessly and is a joy to shoot. has a functioning side folding bayonet and a 20 inch barrel. has date 1955.

All of the metal is in descent condition, but the gun looks like it came from a war zone, which to me adds character to the gun, and most of these Chinese type 53 guns did come from a war zone from Korea to Vietnam to south america. The stock has no cracks or major gashes but did get a heavy beating from what i presume is from Vietnam. 

this gun is what I would call a collector piece, and what is interesting has Russian markings on the matching Chinese bolt. what my looking into found that this is because Russian engineers helped in manufacturing process in china.

asking 200$ which i think is a very fair price. 
will entertain trades, but will be tough if its not a caliber I own. 7.62x39, 7.62x54r, 9mm makarov, 12 gauge, 22lr

title: For Trade:  ONE OWNER RUGER GP100 SIX INCH STAINLESS CUSTOM
postcontent: My Brother bought this gun new in May of 90. He put 6 rounds of 38 special thru it and put it back in the safe. Some years latter he sent the gun to Ford Guns in Florida where they radius all the corners smoothed out all the sharp spots and polished all the stainless to a mirror finish. The gun is amazing looking and there is not a machine mark on it. It looks as good or better than any bright stainless Python. The gun was then sent to Grant Cunningham where the trigger job was done and all springs replaced with titanium springs. Everything about the trigger was polished and reworked. The single action pull is SCARY and breaks under a pound. The double action feels like its running on ice and is as smooth or smoother than any Python. It has a set of Hogue Rosewood grips and HI VIZ sights. The pistol is amazing looking and there is not a scratch on it any where. At 15 yards free handed you can cut the same hole. Has had less than 300 rounds thru it since new. Would like to trade only but you can feel free to make an offer. Make sure you know what it would cost to duplicate this pistol. WILL NOT RESPOND TO ANY STUPID OFFERS! AND WILL ONLY TRADE FOR ITEMS LISTED BELOW! Thanks for looking.
